Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop

Class ComponentRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ComponentRegistry
  • public class ComponentRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple dependency injection container for Gumdrop components. Manages component lifecycle and dependency wiring without external dependencies.

    This registry provides:

    • Component registration by ID
    • Dependency resolution with circular detection
    • Singleton lifecycle management
    • Type-safe component retrieval
    • Automatic property injection via setters
    • Optional lifecycle methods (init/destroy)
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register​(java.lang.String id,
                     ComponentDefinition definition)
        Register a component definition.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique component identifier
        definition - the component definition
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if id is null or already registered

      • getComponent

        public <T> T getComponent​(java.lang.String id,
                          java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get or create a component instance by ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the component identifier
        type - the expected component type
        Returns:
        the component instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no component registered with this id
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if circular dependency detected
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if component is not of expected type

      • getComponent

        public java.lang.Object getComponent​(java.lang.String id)
        Get a component instance by ID without type checking.
        Parameters:
        id - the component identifier
        Returns:
        the component instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no component registered with this id
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if circular dependency detected

      • hasComponent

        public boolean hasComponent​(java.lang.String id)
        Check if a component with the given ID is registered.
        Parameters:
        id - the component identifier
        Returns:
        true if registered, false otherwise

      • getComponentsOfType

        public <T> java.util.Collection<T> getComponentsOfType​(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get all components of a given type. This will instantiate all matching components.
        Parameters:
        type - the component type
        Returns:
        collection of all matching components
